snippet: A potential compromise in Europe’s battle between deficit-cutting austerity and policies to promote growth has begun to take shape.
abstract: Potential compromise in Europe’s battle between deficit-cutting austerity and policies to promote growth has begun to take shape, as trend shifts away from forcing heavily indebted countries to cut spending too quickly and deeply; Germany has expressed measured willingness to tolerate slightly higher inflation and allow modest but real wage growth, which would make it easier for debt-ridden European countries to compete.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS KULISH and JACK EWING

lead_paragraph: A potential compromise in Europe’s battle between deficit-cutting austerity and policies to promote growth has begun to take shape.

headline.seo: Europe Moving Toward Small Steps to Promote Growth
headline.main: Germany Signals It Will Permit Small Steps to Promote Growth in Europe
headline.print_headline: Germany Signals It Will Permit Small Steps to Promote Growth in Europe
